primitives

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • primitives.Line

  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a line by means of three coefficients a, b and c, where ax + by + c = 0 holds.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double a 
      private double b 
      private double c 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(double a, double b, double c)
      Initializes a line by the three coefficients a, b and c, where ax + by + c = 0 holds.
      Line(Point p1, Point p2)
      Initializes a line by two different points lying on it.
      Line(Segment s)
      Initializes a line by a segment lying on it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getA()
      Returns the a coefficient for the line, where ax + by + c = 0 holds.
      double getAngle()
      Calculates the angle that the line makes with the positive direction of the X axis.

      Returns the b coefficient for the line, where ax + by + c = 0 holds.

      Returns the c coefficient for the line, where ax + by + c = 0 holds.

      Calculates the perpendicular line that passes through the given point.

      Calculates the intersection of two lines.
      boolean isAscending()
      Determines whether the line is ascending (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that lies in (0, pi/2).
      boolean isDescending()
      Determines whether the line is descending (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that lies in (pi/2, pi).
      boolean isHorizontal()
      Determines whether the line is horizontal (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that is equal to pi.

      Determines whether the point lies on the left side of the line.

      Determines whether the point lies on the right side of the line.

      Determines whether the line is undefined (e.g.
      boolean isVertical()
      Determines whether the line is vertical (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that is equal to pi/2.

      Determines whether the point lies on the line.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      double XforY(double y)
      Calculates the X coordinate of a point on the line by its Y coordinate.
      double YforX(double x)
      Calculates the Y coordinate of a point on the line by its X coordinate.

        Determines whether the point lies on the line.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isAscending

        public boolean isAscending()
        Determines whether the line is ascending (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that lies in (0, pi/2).
        Returns:
        true, if the line is ascending, false otherwise

      • isVertical

        public boolean isVertical()
        Determines whether the line is vertical (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that is equal to pi/2.
        Returns:
        true, if the line is vertical, false otherwise

      • isDescending

        public boolean isDescending()
        Determines whether the line is descending (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that lies in (pi/2, pi).
        Returns:
        true, if the line is descending, false otherwise

      • isHorizontal

        public boolean isHorizontal()
        Determines whether the line is horizontal (that is, makes an angle with the positive direction of the X axis that is equal to pi.
        Returns:
        true, if the line is horizontal, false otherwise

      • isUndefined

        public boolean isUndefined()
        Determines whether the line is undefined (e.g. two equal points were passed to the constructor).
        Returns:
        true, if the line is undefined, false otherwise

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Calculates the angle that the line makes with the positive direction of the X axis.
        Returns:
        The angle in radians

        public boolean isLeftPoint(Point p)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true, if the point lies in the left halfplane, false otherwise
